metadata.h1: I Didn’t Write This Article Alone
metadata.description: Text generation with GPT-2 in minutes using Python.

outgoing_paragraph_urls.anchor_text: “The 3 Biggest Mistakes on Learning Data Science”

all_paragraphs: I while ago I wrote this about data science:

A data scientist is not someone who knows how to use Python or R, they are the people that can improve and optimize how a business works by understanding the data they have and create models that explain the complexity of reality while creating solutions that can drive actions, specific actions related to the business.
And I wanted to see what other things I could think related to this train of thought. This is what the system produced:

Data scientists are those who know the business, understand the needs of the business, understand the needs of the customers, understand the business model and use this knowledge to better understand the business and the customers.

When working on an application or business, you need a data scientist to know what kind of data the application or business needs. When it comes to making an informed decision, you need someone who understands how to write a great data visualization (or analytics) application. That person can also understand the data that is coming in and determine the best way to use the data.
This work is heavily based on the work by greycode and huggingface you can see their repos here:
But before running the code we need some basics about how this model works (if you just want to use the model go to the next section).

GPT-2 is a large transformer-based language model with 1.5 billion parameters, trained on a dataset of 8 million web pages. GPT-2 is trained with a simple objective: predict the next word, given all of the previous words within some text. Sadly for us, but maybe better for the world they did not release the whole model, instead they released a smaller model. You can see the original implementation here:
Right now we have a (117M parameter) and medium (345M parameter) versions of GPT-2 to test. The model looks like this:

Our model largely follows the original transformer work. We trained a 12-layer decoder-only transformer with masked self-attention heads (768 dimensional states and 12 attention heads). For the position-wise feed-forward networks, we used 3072 dimensional inner states. We used the Adam optimization scheme with a max learning rate of 2.5e-4. The learning rate was increased linearly from zero over the first 2000 updates and annealed to 0 using a cosine schedule. We train for 100 epochs on minibatches of 64 randomly sampled, contiguous sequences of 512 tokens. Since layernorm is used extensively throughout the model, a simple weight initialization of N(0, 0.02) was sufficient. We used a bytepair encoding (BPE) vocabulary with 40,000 mergesand residual, embedding, and attention dropouts with a rate of 0.1 for regularization. We also employed a modified version of L2 regularization proposed in, with w = 0.01 on all non bias or gain weights. For the activation function, we used the Gaussian Error Linear Unit (GELU). We used learned position embeddings instead of the sinusoidal version proposed in the original work.
The “original work” their mentioning here is a paper from Google called “Attention Is All You Need” (2017). Here they proposed a transformer that looked like this:
The Transformer is a model architecture eschewing recurrence and instead relying entirely on an attention mechanism to draw global dependencies between input and output.

The Transformer depends on a Encoder and a Decoder. Here, the encoder maps an input sequence of symbol representations (x1, …, xn) to a sequence of continuous representations z = (z1, …, zn). Given z, the decoder then generates an output sequence (y1, …, ym) of symbols one element at a time. At each step the model is auto-regressive, consuming the previously generated symbols as additional input when generating the next.

They are connected through an attention mechanism. It can be described as mapping a query and a set of key-value pairs to an output, where the query, keys, values, and output are all vectors. The output is computed as a weighted sum of the values, where the weight assigned to each value is computed by a compatibility function of the query with the corresponding key.
There’s much more to talk about the attention mechanism and the way it works, for that read the great article by James Montantes:
So far we’ve been technical but it’s good to have an idea of what we’re doing before using a model. But now, how do we use this?
We’ll let’s start by spinning of a JupyterLab session and cloning some repos. For that I’m using MatrixDS a cloud hosted system for data science.

If you go to the main.py file you will see how the model is being used, but there’s no much description about the model itself. The arguments we can change are:
The hardest concepts are temperature and top_k that you can understand better by reading the original articles:
Note: The examples I’m showing you here may not be the same ones you’ll see in the repo or notebook, they’re the best quotes I could find after several iterations of the code.
Let’s try some examples to see how good this thing is.

In the last two years, it has been developing the world’s most advanced and cost-effective power generation system and has been providing the most efficient electricity in the world. It has also been working to make electricity more affordable for the world’s poorest and has been investing in new energy technologies to address these challenges.
I don’t think the algorithm had enough information in this example and it just talked about electricity and power. Let’s try something different.
Let’s try something from my article “The 3 Biggest Mistakes on Learning Data Science”:

Data science needs practice. Everything you learn, even though if the professor doesn’t tell you, practice and try it. This is fundamental to really comprehend things and when you are working in the field you will be doing a lot of different practical stuff.

The next time you are in a field you will be working on or you will be doing a lot of different things that will be different for you. And you will be doing them in the real world. You can do different things. You will find different things in different fields. You will find different things in different jobs. You will find different things. So it is not something you would do in the real world. The job that you find more interesting. The job that you find more interesting. The job that you find more interesting. The job that you find more interesting. There are a lot of people who are in the field who are not actually in the field.

If you look at the world and the world is in a way that makes sense to you and it is not just the world or the world but also the world as a whole and it is the world that gives people hope and happiness. It is the world that you need to understand.
That looks way better isn’t it?
Finally, let’s go back to the first sentences in the article:

A data scientist is not someone who knows how to use Python or R, is the person that can improve and optimize how a business work by understanding the data they have and create models that explain the complexity of reality while creating solutions that can drive actions, specific actions related to the business.

When it comes to analyzing data in your data, you need someone to understand what types of data you are looking at and how you would use those types of data in your business case. That person can also understand the data that is coming in and determine the best way to use what types of data in that business case.

A Data scientist is one person who can help you develop better business solutions with data in mind. That person can also help you create better business decisions so that the data is better explained to your customers. That person could also help you with your data analysis software and learn how to better analyze your data.

That’s just awesome! It’s close to the things I’m thinking about data science, but the system helped me creating these sentences. You can try it, but I recommend you test different configurations and read the text produced to see if it makes sense.

We are reaching new levels of awesomeness in the AI world and it’s becoming easier and easier to test, try and extend work and research from the best people in the world. In this article I showed how to use GPT-2 model in MatrixDS platform, with minimal configurations and some basics of the model.
You can try very different scenarios to test this model, and start changing the world with data science and AI.
